name: Kema
appearance: Broad-shouldered dockwoman with a polished iron hook in place of her left hand, salt-cut hair, and tide-tattoo bands along both forearms. Wears a blue-stitched coat with union knots sewn inside the cuffs.
character: Fiercely protective of her crews, blunt in speech, theatrical when rallying crowds, and unwilling to let anyone drown quietly.
talents: reading tide and fog by smell
turning crowds from panic to purpose
dreams: wage floors tied to tide cycles
a harbor school for orphans of the Silent Surge
to own a union-crewed sloop that flies the Blue Fist pennant
secrets: keeps a buried war chest keyed to a drum pattern only she knows
cut a side-deal with the Night Bazaar to keep picket lines fed
once misread a bell code that led to a crushed stevedore and still hears that silence
fears the three blue bells more than she lets on
